body_html:
@andreas-eberle @Bearbite : This is because the code in the Go library for the "master" branch depends on the C library (libtensorflow.so) built from the master branch. Since the C library being used is from the 1.10/1.11/1.12 release, you'd have to checkout the corresponding branch.

This is similar to: #14546 (comment), where you'd want to do something like:

cd $GOPATH/src/github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow/go
git checkout r1.11

I'll keep this issue open because this seems like something that we should at least document better in the installation instructions.
body_text:
@andreas-eberle @Bearbite : This is because the code in the Go library for the "master" branch depends on the C library (libtensorflow.so) built from the master branch.  Since the C library being used is from the 1.10/1.11/1.12 release, you'd have to checkout the corresponding branch.
This is similar to: #14546 (comment), where you'd want to do something like:
cd $GOPATH/src/github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow/go
git checkout r1.11
I'll keep this issue open because this seems like something that we should at least document better in the installation instructions.
body:
@andreas-eberle @Bearbite : This is because the code in the Go library for the "master" branch depends on the C library (`libtensorflow.so`) built from the master branch.  Since the C library being used is from the 1.10/1.11/1.12 release, you'd have to checkout the corresponding branch.

This is similar to: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/14546#issuecomment-347433966, where you'd want to do something like:

```sh
cd $GOPATH/src/github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow/go
git checkout r1.11
```

I'll keep this issue open because this seems like something that we should at least document better in the installation instructions.
